page.title: 01DESCRIPTION OF AREA
page.content: The area is mainly farmland, but includes the village of {Hanbury}which is situated between Bromsgrove and Droitwich on the B4090. The village has a population of about eight hundred people. The name{Hanbury is derived from a Saxon word meaning "High town". This is probably due to the position of the church two miles north west of the village centre. Main buildings include the {Vernon {Arms}public house named after the Vernon Family late owners of nearby { {Hanbury Hall.}The Village hall dates from eighteen ninetytwo. There is a small memorial garden with a stone cross in the village commemorating men killed in the second world war.
